# For this instance, there are n vertices, 0...n-1.
# Use the values of r and s as the vertices for flow source and sink.
# The list 'Edges' stores triples (i,j,c) where c is the capacity of the directed edge (i,j).

# The following is Sage code to "Show" the graph. (It will be messy!)
pos = {\
  0 : (8.29,7.40),   1 : (62.52,42.38),   2 : (20.70,2.68),   3 : (66.01,29.43),   4 : (3.58,19.37),   5 : (14.30,43.90),   6 : (50.14,11.29),   7 : (45.99,23.30),   8 : (19.50,40.22),   9 : (46.65,19.00),\

};
G = DiGraph(n);
for i,j,c in Edges:
	G.add_edge( i,j, str(c) );
G.set_pos(pos);
G.show(vertex_labels=False,vertex_size=1, figsize=[12,12]);
